intro: Walafrida diffusa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a rosette of leaves with a central stem that bears the flowers. Its leaves are usually dark green and velvety, while the flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, blue, and white. Walafrida diffusa is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
